description.google:
This study is conducted for research purposes. Data will be collected and analyzed as described in our Privacy Policy, linked here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WOBUXwyXHHipvtXtm1V0jbvqNZy7rjxUNs_v9LxOVOc/edit?usp=sharing. Participation is voluntary, and you may exit the study at any time without penalty. By continuing, you confirm that you have reviewed the Privacy Policy and consent to take part in this study.

In this task, you will add disfluency annotations to [TARGET_LANGUAGE] text. You will be shown an English sentence with disfluencies already marked using underscores (e.g., _uh_, _you know_), alongside a [TARGET_LANGUAGE] translation that is missing these markers.

Your job:
1. Read the English text to see which words are disfluencies (marked with _underscores_).
2. Copy the [TARGET_LANGUAGE] text into the answer box.
3. Add underscores around the **equivalent** disfluent words in [TARGET_LANGUAGE], matching the English pattern.

IMPORTANT RULES:
- Every opening underscore _ MUST have a closing underscore _. They always come in pairs.
- Example: _well_ is correct. _well is WRONG (missing closing underscore).
- Do NOT change the [TARGET_LANGUAGE] text itself. Only add _ markers.
- Work independently on each item. Spend no more than 3 minutes per item.
